content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

You can create the `add_yearmonth` function in Julia using the following code:

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame, col_name::String = "dt"))
    @info "Adding year-month column to DataFrame..."
    
    # Extract year and month from dt column
    df[!, Symbol("ym")] = String.(DateTime(df[:, col_name]])) .|>
        map(x -> split(x, "-", 2))[1] .|>
        map(int)

    @info "Year-month column added successfully."
end
```

You can now use this function on your DataFrame `df`:

```julia
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will create a new column `ym` in the DataFrame containing the year and month extracted from the original datetime column.
